page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY - Lydham
page.content:
ARCHAEOLOGY -{Neolithic Period}- stone axes found near Lydham and at Mores' Wood. Pottery found at Roveries hill- fort. {Iron Age}- 2 hillforts on Roveries Hill. Lower camp has a rampart round hilltop with 2 entrances, 1 with guard-chambers and gateposts still visible. {Medieval motte and bailey 'castle' clearly visible behind Lydham Church. Strategic position looking into Wales. Church C13th restored 1885. Records and Oakley Family papers in Shropshire Record Office.
At Domesday 1087 Lydham was recorded as having a priest, a church and a mill.
